data.prayer: Spirit, encourage the church in Murshidabad, West Bengal, India to make the most of every opportunity.
data.verse: Be very careful, then, how you live—not as unwise but as wise, making the most of every opportunity, because the days are evil.

data.location_label: Photo from the county of Murshidabad, West Bengal, India
data.section_summary: What people or activities could you pray for in this photo?

data.prayer: Spirit, build the strength and maturity of the local leaders in Murshidabad, West Bengal, India. Show them that faithfulness is more important than knowledge. Show them that the Spirit, the Word, and prayer is enough in order to grow and lead.
Father, encourage your church in Murshidabad that you never forsake them.
data.verse: Those who know your name will put their trust in you, for you, Yahweh, have not forsaken those who seek you.

data.prayer: Lord, we pray for the believers in Murshidabad, West Bengal, India to be more like Jesus in their love for friends and enemies.
data.verse: But I tell you, love your enemies and pray for those who persecute you.

data.prayer: Spirit, I pray that the Mallah Kewat (Muslim traditions) people will come and worship before you, Lord. May they glorify your name for you are great.
Jesus, please bless the leaders of the the county of Murshidabad, West Bengal, India who work hard at shepherding and guiding your people.
data.verse: With upright heart he shepherded them and guided them with his skillful hand.

data.prayer: Spirit, teach those feeling unsafe in Murshidabad, West Bengal, India that they can hide under your wings
data.verse: He will cover you with his feathers, and under his wings you will find refuge; his faithfulness will be your shield and rampart.

data.prayer: Spirit, how will they hear without a preacher? How will they preach unless they have a Bible? Please give the people in the county of Murshidabad access to a Bible in their own language.
data.verse: How, then, can they call on the one they have not believed in? And how can they believe in the one of whom they have not heard? And how can they hear without someone preaching to them? And how can anyone preach unless they are sent? As it is written: “How beautiful are the feet of those who bring good news!”

location.name: Murshidabad
location.people_groups_list: Brahmin Madhyasreni, Mallah (Muslim traditions), Mochi (Hindu traditions), Aguri, Mallah Chain (Muslim traditions)
